purpleculture_pinyin:
xiōng
torrential rush; tumultuous
проливной порыв; шумный
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 汹)
Pictophonetic: 匈 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
洶湧 [ xiōng yǒng ]: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc); turbulent
洶涌澎湃 [ xiōng yǒng péng pài ]: surging; turbulent; tempestuous (idiom)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 匈 [ xiōng ] breast, chest, thorax; to clamor; Hungary
heisig_chinese_memo: Being bound up in a turbulent plane on a long flight over the ocean water can be a sinister experience for some people.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The cruel water of a tsunami is as turbulent as it gets.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " water " and " Hungary ", the original meaning is the appearance of rising water. "Shuowen": "Yong Ye. From the water, the sound of Hungary." Tan Dufu "Shuihuidu": "Before the big river moves me, it is raging and wide."

" Mag " can be described as loud. "Songs of the Chu-Nine Chapters-Sorrowful Return to the Wind": "The rush of the turbulent turbulence, the turbulent sound of the waves."

" Men " can also be described as strong. Tang Huangtao "Rong Jie as Heyue Fu": "Rigidity and softness followed by turbulent, and craving followed by prosperous."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " water " and " Hungary ", the original meaning is the appearance of rising water.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「匈」聲，本義為水波騰涌貌。《說文》：「涌也。从水，匈聲。」唐杜甫〈水會渡〉：「大江動我前，洶若溟渤寬。」

　　「洶」可形容聲音大。《楚辭‧九章‧悲回風》：「憚涌湍之磕磕兮，聽波聲之洶洶。」

　　「洶」也可形容聲勢壯大。唐黃滔〈融結為河岳賦〉：「剛柔隨之而洶湧，嗜欲繼之而隆崇。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「匈」聲，本義為水波騰涌貌。

Pictophonetic: 匈 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.

    • 匈 [ xiōng ] breast, chest, thorax; to clamor; Hungary

洶涌澎湃 [ xiōng yǒng péng pài ]: surging; turbulent; tempestuous (idiom)

從「 水 」，「 匈 」聲，本義為水波騰涌貌。《說文》：「涌也。从水，匈聲。」唐杜甫〈水會渡〉：「大江動我前，洶若溟渤寬。」 「 洶 」可形容聲音大。《楚辭‧九章‧悲回風》：「憚涌湍之磕磕兮，聽波聲之洶洶。」 「 洶 」也可形容聲勢壯大。唐黃滔〈融結為河岳賦〉：「剛柔隨之而洶湧，嗜欲繼之而隆崇。」
From the sound of " water" and " Hungary", the original meaning is the appearance of rising water. "Shuowen": "Yong Ye. From the water, the sound of Hungary." Tan Dufu "Shuihuidu": "Before the big river moves me, it is raging and wide." " Mag" can be described as loud. "Songs of the Chu-Nine Chapters-Sorrowful Return to the Wind": "The rush of the turbulent turbulence, the turbulent sound of the waves." " Men" can also be described as strong. Tang Huangtao "Rong Jie as Heyue Fu": "Rigidity and softness followed by turbulent, and craving followed by prosperous."

洶字的基本解释

洶
xiōng
同“汹”。

洶字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiōng］
［《廣韻》許容切，平鍾，曉。］
［《廣韻》許拱切，上腫，曉。］
亦作“汹1”。
(1)水波腾涌貌。
(2)形容声音大；喧嚣。
(3)形容纷扰。参见“洶洶”、“洶怖”。
(4)形容气势盛大。参见“洶洶”、“洶涌”、“洶猛”。

洶字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　洶； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页622第13
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?許拱切，音詾。【說文】湧也。一曰洶涌，水聲。　又洶洶，鼓動聲。【揚雄·羽獵賦】洶洶旭旭。　又【集韻】筍勇切，音竦。義同。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】許容切【韻會】虛容切，?音匈。義同。一曰水勢。【左思·吳都賦】濞焉洶洶。

洶字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
洶字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiōng］
["Guangyun" Xu Rongqie, Ping Zhong, Xiao. ]
["Guangyun" Xu Gongqie, swollen top, Xiao. ]
Also known as "Magical 1".
(1) The surging appearance of water waves.
(2) Describe loud; noisy.
(3) Describe turbulence. See "menacing", "menacing".
(4) Describe grand vigor. See "turbulent", "turbulent", "turbulent".

The same meaning.　 [Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun] Xu Rongqie [Rhyme Hui] Xu Rongqie is empty and cut,? Yin Hung. The same meaning. One is the water potential. 【Zuo Si·Wu Du Fu】Bai Yan menacing.
